availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Albert D. Kingman (Fulton County, KY, attorney, soldier, and prov govt)

body.p: Fulton County, Kentucky, attorney, soldier, and provisional government convention member. Massachusetts native. Married to Mary Kingman. Father of Sophia Kingman, Frank Kingman, Albert D. Kingman, Charles B. Kingman, Walter G. Kingman, and Kate Kingman. Attorney in Fulton County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Fulton County in 1850. Attorney in Fulton County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861. Served in the 1st Tennessee Heavy Artillery (C.S.A.) as a captain and assistant quarter master from December 10, 1861 to 1864. Captured at Vicksburg July 4, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fulton County, Hickman, p. 111A.

Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fulton County, Hickman, p. 357A.

Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Tennessee, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M268, Roll 0087.
